meanings.definition: One who truckles or yields in a servile manner.
meanings.sent1: The truckler always agreed with the boss, never daring to disagree.
meanings.sent2: The king's court was full of trucklers who constantly flattered him.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse played the role of a truckler to the big cat, pretending to be its friend.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the villain was portrayed as a cunning truckler, manipulating others for his gain.
meanings.sent5: The image of a truckler bowing down to authority stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: To act in a subservient manner; to submit or yield.
meanings.sent1: She would often truckler to her older sister's demands, always giving in to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent2: The employee decided to truckler to his boss's unreasonable request to keep his job.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed to truckler to every command, following them without question.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the trees truckler, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: He had to truckler to the rules of the game if he wanted to play with the group.
